clues.text: Alan Alda personified this title bird captured by a pussycat in the 1964 Broadway hit
Anne Bancroft won a Tony for her Broadway debut as 1 of the "Two for" this playground toy
In Willy Russell's play Frank is an English tutor who tried educating this hairdresser
The entire action of this 1951 play takes place in a bedroom & much of it on the title bed
Hume Cronyn & Jessica Tandy got to know each other over the title pastime in this 1977 play

rounds.category: FOOD AS YOU MIGHT SAY IT

clues.text:
It's got buns, hon:
the untidy Jose

In the ice cream aisle:
lithic lane

Southern fried fun:
silence, curs!

A hero in the South:
destitute lad

Tiramisu turf:
dame digits
After Jed Clampett discovered oil on his Appalachian property, he loaded up his family & moved to this more affluent locale
The 2016 EP "Coconut Oil" was the first major label release for this Big Grrrl rap & pop artist
Upton Sinclair's novel "Oil!" was the basis for this movie that won Daniel Day-Lewis an Oscar
Forever seeking to kidnap his sweetheart, Oil Can Harry was a villainous cat adversary of this rodent superhero
"Beds Are Burning" was the biggest U.S. hit for this political-minded Australian band
You get an adjacent letter if you don't know it's the 7th letter of the English alphabet
In French, W has this name, which makes more sense
Our letter K comes from this Greek one
Many Brits put an "intrusive" one between words that end with a vowel sound & words that start with one
Now often confused with F, the "long" form of this lowercase letter disappeared from English in the 1800s
When this gloomy outlook follows "electro", it refers to the ability of an atom to attract electron pairs
A cup of instant coffee is a solution & adding water is this process, the opposite of concentration
In chemistry it describes a substance that evaporates readily; it's the V in mVOC, smelly compounds produced by molds
Orpiment, formula As<sub>2</sub>S<sub>3</sub> was a longtime aid to painters as a yellow pigment, but not now, due to this, the As
Named for their 2 constituent elements, these compounds such as propane & octane are often used for fuel

rounds.category: THAT'S SOME OF WHAT SHE WROTE

clues.text: Her resum√© includes 2 novels published 55 years apart & a 1983 essay about the history of Alabama
Written in 1991, "The Kitchen God's Wife" drew on her experiences as the Americanized daughter of a Chinese mother
In addition to her numerous books for younger readers like "Superfudge", she wrote a few for adults, including "Wifey" in 1978
"To Be Young, Gifted and Black" by this playwright was performed Off-Broadway after cancer took her far too young at 34
From a Bengali family, she won a 2000 Pulitzer for exploring the immigrant life in "Interpreter of Maladies"
In his native Boston, Ben wrote that the kids of status-seeking parents come out of this college as blockheads
As royally appointed deputy this 2-word job, Ben got mail from Charleston to Boston by road instead of by ship via London
Ben's discoveries led to the lightning rod & to the end of the electrocution of more than a hundred of these colleagues of Quasimodo
An edit Ben made for Thomas Jefferson changed "we hold these truths to be sacred & undeniable" to this, rational instead of religious
When a friend asked if the Constitution set up a republic or a monarchy, Ben replied, "A republic" followed by these 5 words

rounds.category: WITH A SONG IN YOUR BRAIN

clues.text: This word for a song's main tune is from the Greek for "song"
Originally a song meant to be danced to, today it means a song telling a romantic or sentimental story
To sing in a slow, soft voice, like Bing Crosby
The pleasing combination of simultaneously sounded notes, it was composer Arnold Schoenberg's last word
Publishing company Hal Leonard offers "the world's premier destination for digital" this loose-printed music; kind of an oxymoron
If you're neglected, you may fall through these; in 2020 President Obama said our health systems allow it to happen to the poor
Buccaneers abandoned people on islands this way that begins with a color
This piscine phrase describes someone lost in a new environment
This Latin word follows "in" to describe someone not in attendance
During World War I you didn't want to get lost in this area between opposing trenches
This paralytic disease peaked in the U.S. in the 1950s, closing swimming pools & movie theaters
Isaac Newton was at home for 2 years waiting out this infectious fever
In 1918 & 1919 20-50 million worldwide perished from this, so named for the country where it was widely reported
A 19th century pandemic of this water-borne disease began in the delta region of the Ganges River
Variola major is the virus that causes this acute infectious disease

clues.text: Who ya gonna call in China? "Super Power Dare Die Team"

The hero of this Stevenson novel finds himself on a ship he had no intention of sailing on--yup, he's been this title
A work by James Fenimore Cooper sometimes called the first espionage novel has this simple title
This oldest member of the 3 Musketeers in Dumas' novel is revealed to be the Comte de la Fere
This Englishwoman wrote 1823's "Valperga"; her first novel also had a one-word title but is more famous
